intro: Chlorospatha betancurii, commonly known as the Betancurii sun-leaf, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and often showy blooms. The plant is distinguished by its bright yellow to greenish-yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chlorospatha betancurii is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or open habitats.
